title.narrative: Innovative ICT for Rural Communities ON

description.narrative:
In February 2012, the Dutch National Postcode Lottery (National Postcode loterij) approved the large and innovative Dreamfund project #Internet Now!# to be implemented in Northern Uganda. Oxfam Novib will implement the project together with 3 other project partners: Arid lands information Network (ALIN), Inveneo and Samasource.
The project is to bring services providing work and income to rural communities in Northern Uganda through reliable, affordable and sustainable high-speed connection to the Internet (providing information access through ICT). One hundred centers will be established to cover 9 districts in Northern Uganda (Gulu, Amuru, Adjumani, Moyo, Kitgum, Pader, Lamwo Nwoya and Agago). These will form a social enterprise following an innovative business model. Each center will offer solar powered workstations housed in shipping containers together with daily support and training by company staff andvolunteers. The centers will be interconnected to the internet through Wi-Fi technology.
The social enterprise to be created by the project will be set up as an independent legal entity established locally in Uganda of which the initial shares will be held by the independent Dutch not for profit Stichting internet Now! SINFA which is to be established in the second quarter of 2012. One of the goals of the project is to make the company self-sustaining so its activities and contribution to the local community can continueafter the initial 3 year funding for the project. . SINFA will provide income generating services in the centres, such as employment through micro work, a specialised form of business process outsourcing. The centres also will give access to an agricultural commodity platform, and other services, all driven by specially designed information technology.
The innovative approach of the internet Now! project requires an intense level of collaboration between all parties which is expressed in the project management structurewith a project management team with members of all the project partners working together in Gulu, Uganda on a daily basis. Next to that a coordination committee with members of all project partners will be established for the project all as further set out in theproject initiation document.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Novib was founded in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Oxfam Novib is member of the Oxfam International confederation. Working together in the confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam Novib's main office is based in The Netherlands, it supports the work of a network of local offices, the implementation of global projects, fundraising, campaigning and advocacy. Oxfam Novib’s the Hague office contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
